subject: Web3
title: Music NFTs
description: A fast breakdown of Music NFTs for builders.

hook.text: Musicians earn fractions of a penny per stream. NFTs let artists sell directly to fans and keep most of the money.

buildup.text: Platforms like Sound.xyz let musicians release songs as NFTs. Fans buy limited editions, funding the artist directly.

discovery.text: Some independent artists earned more from a single NFT drop than a year of streaming royalties.

twist.text: The audience is tiny. Most music fans don't want wallets, crypto, or blockchain. They just want to press play.

climax.text: Music NFTs work for superfans willing to invest. Mass adoption requires hiding the blockchain entirely.

punchline.text: Music NFTs pay artists more. The audience is just much smaller.

quiz.question: What advantage do music NFTs offer artists over streaming?
